page.title: 09Neolith Chemicals-Shawforth
page.content: Neolith Chemicals is an engineering and chemical works. The company uses high pressure pumps for cleaning and maintenance of buildings. Some of the finest buildings in Britain, America, Holland, Portugal and Hungary have been cleaned by them and in addition they hire pumps to North Sea oil rigs. The company opened in Shawforth in 1971 and has branches in towns as far apart as Aberdeen and Bournemouth, plus two branches outside the United Kingdom, one in Holland and one to be opened in Australia. Neolith chemicals and high pressure water jetting can be very dangerous. Some of the chemicals can blind you and the small pumps deliver water at a force of 2000 pounds per square inch. Only competent stone cleaning contractors are allowed to use them.
